question: If i want to get abs, is eating brown bread bad?
question_content: Basically i want abs. I do weights, situps, crunches and that every other day. I usally eat fast food 2-3 times a week. I have been doing my abs for over a month now, and still see no improvment? Im already quite skinny its just the belly fat covering my abs.

answers.answer_content:
Hey, wholemeal bread is a great addition to a healthy diet as it's high in fibre and protein. It won't in any way stop you getting abs. 

x

Try running too. Fast food is terrible for you. stay away from soda. drink water. also increase your reps/weight. keep a book that says how much you do, what you ate, when you ate, and drink plenty of water. Four meals a day instead of 3 will help trim fat and keep metabolism high just make sure they are just a bit smaller than your regular 3. Make sure to eat breakfast. a healthy enough diet alone is plenty for some people. try finding a workout plan online or download an app on your phone. good luck

Put a two litre water bottle along with a glass on your desk just about every morning. Get through it through lunch, and do the same in the afternoon. You’ll exercise better in addition to recover faster if you’re hydrated. I drink some water every time someone asks me a foolish question or sends a foolish email... find something that works in your case!
It's ok to eat brown bread while trying to get a six pack.To get rid of that belly fat covering your abs, go jogging

Make use of the 20 minute rule. Eat your own portion-controlled meal then, even if you feel hungry afterwards, wait for 20 minutes and find out if you still do. Nine times out of 10, you won’t. If you choose to do, eat 10 per cent a lot more.
Al dente pasta features a lower GI value, so is usually a healthier option than nuking your current fusilli till it’s soggy.

You don’t need to exercise for long periods of time. Short, sharp sets of exercise will produce better results when you work hard. Get a passing up rope, skip for two units, do push ups for 60 seconds or so, skip for two minutes, rest first minute. Then change the push approximately something else like sit ups and also do the set again. Repeat it five times and it’s a simple, effective workout that will improve results than a long manage or swim.

To get abs, it requires a low-fat, low-carb diet. So any high amount of carbs is bad. Fast food.... that will be a habit you will have to completely give up.

-Connor
Get back on basics – burn more unhealthy calories than you ingest.
